name: chronometric-age
title: ChronometricAge
description: An approximation of temporal position (in the sense conveyed by https://www.w3.org/TR/owl-time/#time:TemporalPosition) that is supported by evidence.

fields.name: chronometricAgeID
fields.title: Chronometric Age ID
fields.description: An identifier for a chrono:ChronometricAge.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a globally unique identifier.

fields.name: eventID
fields.title: Event ID
fields.description: An identifier for a dwc:Event.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a globally unique identifier.

fields.name: verbatimChronometricAge
fields.title: Verbatim Chronometric Age
fields.description: A verbatim age for a dwc:Event, whether reported by a dating assay, associated references, or legacy information.
fields.comments: For example, this could be the radiocarbon age as given in an AMS dating report. This could also be simply what is reported as the age of a specimen in legacy collections data.

fields.name: chronometricAgeProtocol
fields.title: Chronometric Age Protocol
fields.description: A description of or reference to a Protocol used to determine a chrono:ChronometricAge.
fields.examples: `radiocarbon AMS`; `K-Ar dates for the lower most marker tuff`; `historic documentation`; `ceramic seriation`

fields.name: chronometricAgeProtocolID
fields.title: Chronometric Age Protocol ID
fields.description: An identifier for a Protocol used to determine a ChronometricAge.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a globally unique identifier.

fields.name: uncalibratedChronometricAge
fields.title: Uncalibrated Chronometric Age
fields.description: An output of a dating assay before it is calibrated into an age using a specific conversion protocol.

fields.name: chronometricAgeConversionProtocol
fields.title: Chronometric Age Conversion Protocol
fields.description: A description of or reference to a Protocol used to convert a chrono:uncalibratedChronometricAge into a chronometric age in years, as captured in the chrono:earliestChronometricAge, chrono:earliestChronometricAgeReferenceSystem, chrono:latestChronometricAge, and chrono:latestChronometricAgeReferenceSystem fields.
fields.comments: For example, calibration of conventional radiocarbon age or the currently accepted age range of a cultural or geological period.
fields.examples: `INTCAL13`; `sequential 6 phase Bayesian model and IntCal13 calibration`

fields.name: chronometricAgeConversionProtocolID
fields.title: Chronometric Age Conversion Protocol ID
fields.description: An identifier for a Protocol used to convert a chrono:uncalibratedChronometricAge into a chronometric age in years, as captured in the chrono:earliestChronometricAge, chrono:earliestChronometricAgeReferenceSystem, chrono:latestChronometricAge, and chrono:latestChronometricAgeReferenceSystem fields.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a globally unique identifier.

fields.name: earliestChronometricAge
fields.title: Earliest Chronometric Age
fields.description: A maximum/earliest/oldest possible age of a dwc:MaterialEntity as determined by a dating method.
fields.comments: The expected unit for this field is years. This field, if populated, must have an associated chrono:earliestChronometricAgeReferenceSystem.

fields.name: earliestChronometricAgeReferenceSystem
fields.title: Earliest Chronometric Age Reference System
fields.description: A reference system associated with a chrono:earliestChronometricAge.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary.

fields.name: latestChronometricAge
fields.title: Latest Chronometric Age
fields.description: A minimum/latest/youngest possible age of a dwc:MaterialEntity as determined by a dating method.
fields.comments: The expected unit for this field is years. This field, if populated, must have an associated latestChronometricAgeReferenceSystem.

fields.name: latestChronometricAgeReferenceSystem
fields.title: Latest Chronometric Age Reference System
fields.description: A reference system associated with a chrono:latestChronometricAge.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary.

fields.name: chronometricAgeUncertaintyInYears
fields.title: Chronometric Age Uncertainty In Years
fields.description: A temporal uncertainty of a chrono:earliestChronometricAge and chrono:latestChronometicAge in years.
fields.comments: The expected unit for this field is years. The value in this field is number of years before and after the values given in the earliest and latest chronometric age fields within which the actual values are estimated to be.

fields.name: chronometricAgeUncertaintyMethod
fields.title: Chronometric Age Uncertainty Method
fields.description: A method used to generate a value of chrono:ChronometricAgeUncertaintyInYears.

fields.name: materialDated
fields.title: Material Dated
fields.description: A description of a dwc:MaterialEntity on which a chrono:ChronometricAgeProtocol was actually performed, if known.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a globally unique identifier.
fields.examples: `Double Tuff`; `Charcoal found in Stratum V`; `charred wood`; `tooth`

fields.name: materialDatedID
fields.title: Material Dated ID
fields.description: An identifier for a dwc:MaterialEntity on which a chrono:ChronometricAgeProtocol was performed, if applicable.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a globally unique identifier.

fields.name: materialDatedRelationship
fields.title: Material Dated Relationship
fields.description: A relationship of a chrono:materialDated to a dwc:MaterialEntity, from which a chrono:ChronometricAge of the related dwc:MaterialEntity and any related dwc:Occurrence is inferred.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a controlled vocabulary.
fields.examples: `sameAs` (cases where the subject material was completely destructively subsampled to get the chrono:ChronometricAge); `subsampleOf` (cases where part of the original dwc:MaterialEntity was extracted as the material used to determine the chrono:ChronometricAge); `inContextWith` (cases where the chrono:ChronometricAge is inferred from materialDated, such as sediments or cultural objects, in related temporal context); `stratigraphicallyCorrelatedWith` (cases where the chrono:ChronometricAge is inferred from materialDated in a stratigraphically correlated context)

fields.name: chronometricAgeDeterminedBy
fields.title: Chronometric Age Determined By
fields.description: A list (concatenated and separated) of names of Agents responsible for determining the chrono:ChronometricAge.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to separate the values in a list with space vertical bar space ( | ).

fields.name: chronometricAgeDeterminedByID
fields.title: Chronometric Age Determined By ID
fields.description: An identifier for an Agent responsible for determining a chrono:ChronometricAge.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to provide a single identifier that disambiguates the details of the acting agent. If a list is used, the order of the agents on the list should not be assumed to convey any semantics. Recommended best practice is to separate the values in a list with space vertical bar space (` | `).

fields.name: chronometricAgeDeterminedDate
fields.title: Chronometric Age Determined Date
fields.description: A date on which a chrono:ChronometricAge was determined.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to use a date that conforms to ISO 8601-1:2019.
fields.examples: `1963-03-08T14:07-06:00` (8 Mar 1963 at 2:07pm in the time zone six hours earlier than UTC); `2009-02-20T08:40Z` (20 February 2009 8:40am UTC); `2018-08-29T15:19` (3:19pm local time on 29 August 2018); `1809-02-12` (some time during 12 February 1809); `1906-06` (some time in June 1906); `1971` (some time in the year 1971).

fields.name: chronometricAgeReferences
fields.title: Chronometric Age References
fields.description: A list (concatenated and separated) of identifiers (publication, bibliographic reference, global unique identifier, URI) of literature associated with the chrono:ChronometricAge.
fields.comments: Recommended best practice is to separate the values in a list with space vertical bar space ( | ).
fields.examples: `Pluckhahn, Thomas J., Neill J. Wallis, and Victor D. Thompson. 2020 The History and Future of Migrationist Explanation in the Archaeology of the Eastern Woodlands: A Review and Case Study of the Woodland Period Gulf Coast. Journal of Archaeological Research. https://doi.org/10.1007/s10814-019-09140-x`

fields.name: chronometricAgeRemarks
fields.title: Chronometric Age Remarks
fields.description: Comments or notes about a chrono:ChronometricAge.
fields.examples: `Beta Analytic number: 323913 | One of the Crassostrea virginica right valve specimens from North Midden Feature 17 was chosen for AMS dating, but it is unclear exactly which specimen it was.`
